results.name: Stirling2 triangle with scaled diagonals (powers of 4).
comment: This is a lower triangular infinite matrix of the Jabotinsky type. See the Knuth reference given in A039692 for exponential convolution arrays.
The row polynomials p(n,x) := Sum_{m=1..n} a(n,m)x^m, n >= 1, have e.g.f. J(x; z)= exp((exp(4*z) - 1)*x/4) - 1

Also the inverse Bell transform of the quadruple factorial numbers 4^n*n! (A047053) adding 1,0,0,0,... as column 0. For the definition of the Bell transform see A264428 and for cross-references A265604. - _Peter Luschny_, Dec 31 2015

program: # Adds a column 1,0,0,... at the left side of the triangle.
multifact_4_4 = lambda n: prod(4*k + 4 for k in (0..n-1))
